Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) making her life better. In both cases she risks everything to escape into a Utopia like one ruled by robots.
The only difference was that in America 3000, her boyfriend comes along as his role is diminished.
